actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on December 16, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Bresnahan moved that the House do now adjourn.

Mr. Bresnahan asked unanimous consent that the proceedings during the former Members program be printed in the Congressional Record and that all Members and former Members who spoke during the proceedings have the privilege of revising and extending their remarks. Agreed to without objection.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the victims of the recent tragedy at Brown University.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 388
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 336).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3187 — "To require the Secretary of Agriculture to convey a parcel of property of the Forest Service to Perry County, Arkansas, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 370
actions-list.actionItem: 22 (Roll no. 335).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 284 — "To reauthorize the Congressional Award Act."
The Chair announced the unfinished business is the question on motions to suspend the rules which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 15.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 P.M. today.

Pursuant to section 2 of the Civil Rights Commission Amendments Act of 1994 (42 U.S.C. 1975), and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker reappointed Mr. Peter N. Kirsanow, Cleveland, Ohio, effective December 16, 2025.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2400.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Stauber moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2400 — "To take certain Federal land in the State of California into trust for the benefit of the Pit River Tribe."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1098.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Stauber moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1098 — "To reauthorize the Junior Duck Stamp Conservation and Design Program Act of 1994."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3872.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Stauber moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3872 — "To amend the Mineral Leasing Act for Acquired Lands to make that Act applicable to hardrock minerals."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3187.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Stauber moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3187 — "To require the Secretary of Agriculture to convey a parcel of property of the Forest Service to Perry County, Arkansas, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3176.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Stauber moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3176 — "To amend the John D. Dingell, Jr. Conservation, Management, and Recreation Act to reauthorize the National Volcano Early Warning and Monitoring System."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3620.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Stauber moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 3620 — "To provide for the conveyance of certain property to the Southcentral Foundation located in Anchorage, Alaska, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2815.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Stauber moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2815 — "To provide equitable treatment for the people of the Village Corporation established for the Native Village of Saxman, Alaska, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2878.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Stauber moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 2878 — "To reauthorize funding to monitor, assess, and research the Great Lakes Basin, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1045.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Stauber moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1045 — "To amend the Southwest Forest Health and Wildfire Prevention Act of 2004 to require the establishment of an additional Institute under that Act."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House resumed debate on H.R. 972.

The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 240, S. 390, S. 546, S. 610, S. 620, S. 621, S. 622, S. 640, S. 642, S. 719, S. 723, S. 766, S. 1591, S. 1744, H.R. 165, H.R. 504, and H.R. 1491.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 972.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Stauber moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 972 — "To amend the Sloan Canyon National Conservation Area Act to adjust the boundary of the Sloan Canyon National Conservation Area, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2876.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Stauber moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 2876 — "To confirm the use of certain non-Federal land in Salt Lake City, Utah, for public purposes, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3962.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Johnson (SD) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3962 — "To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to reauthorize the National Estuary Program, and for other purposes."
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4183.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Johnson (SD) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4183 — "To authorize appropriations for the Federal Maritime Commission for fiscal years 2026 through 2029, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 216.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Johnson (SD) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 216 — "To amend the Save Our Seas 2.0 Act to improve the administration of the Marine Debris Foundation, to amend the Marine Debris Act to improve the administration of the Marine Debris Program of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 923.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Wittman moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended. H. Res. 923 — "A resolution honoring the service and sacrifice of United States Army Specialist Sarah Beckstrom and United States Air Force Staff Sergeant Andrew Wolfe, who were tragically shot in Washington, D.C., in a targeted assault against United States service members on November 26, 2025."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5457.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Timmons moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5457 — "To improve the visibility, accountability, and oversight of agency software asset management practices, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5810.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Timmons moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5810 — "To provide for mandatory training for Federal Government supervisors and the assessment of management competencies, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 222.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Thompson (PA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 222 — "To amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to allow schools that participate in the school lunch program to serve whole milk, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 284.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Walberg moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 284 — "To reauthorize the Congressional Award Act."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Thompson of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 15.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Tim Moore to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
